{{infobox character | people=[[Númenóreans|Númenórean]] | name=Caliondo | image= | caption= | pronun= | othernames= | titles= | position= | location=[[Númenor]] | affiliation= | language= | birth={{SA|512}} | birthlocation= | rule= | death={{SA|900}} | deathlocation= | age=388 | notablefor= | house=[[House of Elros]] | parentage=[[Eärendur (son of Tar-Amandil)|Eärendur]] | siblings= | spouse= | children=[[Malantur]] | gender=Male | height= | hair= | eyes= | clothing= | weapons= | steed= }}'''Caliondo''' ([[Quenya|Q]], pron. {{IPA|[ˌkaliˈondo]}}) was a [[Númenóreans|Númenórean]] of royal blood, and was the son of [[Eärendur (son of Tar-Amandil)|Eärendur]], who was the younger son of [[King of Númenor|King]] [[Tar-Amandil]]. He himself had one son, [[Malantur]]. Almost nothing is known of his life.{{UT|earlier}} ==Etymology== ''Caliondo'' is a [[Quenya]] name. Its meaning is not glossed, but Helge Fauskanger suggests it may be a longer form of ''[[Calion]]'', unless it contains ''[[ondo]]'' ("rock").{{webcite|author=Helge Fauskanger|articleurl=https://folk.uib.no/hnohf/quen-eng.htm|articlename=''Caliondo''|website=Quettaparma Quenyallo|accessed=21 January 2022}} The meaning of ''Calion'' (the Quenya name of [[Ar-Pharazôn]]) is not glossed, but Paul Strack suggests it means "Son of Light" and is a compound of ''[[cala]]'' ("light") and the patronymic suffix ''[[-ion]]'' ("-son", masculine patronymic).{{webcite|author=Paul Strack|articleurl=https://www.eldamo.org/content/words/word-2978386403.html|articlename=Q. ''Calion'' m.|website=Eldamo|accessed=21 January 2022}} Paul Strack suggests ''Caliondo'' is a combination of ''[[cala]]'' ("light") and the masculine agantal suffix ''[[-ndo]]''.{{webcite|author=Paul Strack|articleurl=https://www.eldamo.org/content/words/word-944453397.html|articlename=Q.
